page.title: 01ALLESBOROUGH FARM.
page.content: Allesborough Farm was listed in the{Domesday Book}of 1086 as the AELIS BOROUGH, that is it belonged to Mr.Aeli, who owned the Borough around the hill. Parts of the farmhouse date back to 1590 and at one time it was inhabited by the{Earl of Coventry. Today there are 17 rooms and three or four people live there. Mr. Bomford, who now farms the land, has lived there all his life - 58 years. The farmland is 620 acres, all of which are rented, except for 16 acres, which belong to{Mr. Bomford.}As crops give more profit than livestock, 444 acres are used for{Arable Farming}as follows. 244 acres _ wheat 27 acres _ potatoes 91 acres _ barley 13 acres _ oats
